user_input: Which NGAP procedure is used for inter-system load balancing? [3GPP Release 17]

reference: enhanced application layer support for v2x services covers the support of advanced v2x services considering existing stage 1 and stage 2 work within 3gpp and v2x application requirements defined outside 3gpp

user_input: What does the Load-Balancing steering mode do? [3GPP Release 17]
response: loadbalancing steering mode optimizes ue distribution across cells to prevent congestion and improve network performance by dynamically directing ues to less loaded cells based on realtime measurements
reference: the loadbalancing steering mode splits the traffic of a data flow across 3gpp and non3gpp accesses in both uplink and downlink directions separately

user_input: What is the main objective of intent driven management for service or network management? [3GPP Release 17]
response: intentdriven management aims to simplify and automate service or network management by allowing operators to specify highlevel goals enhancing operational efficiency and adaptability to changing conditions

user_input: What does MINT stand for? [3GPP Release 17]
response: mint
reference: mint stands for minimization of service interruption

user_input: What is the purpose of the Media Streaming AF Event Exposure work item? [3GPP Release 17]

reference: the work item relates to the support of generic ue data collection reporting and event exposure and the 5g media streaming instantiation of the generic functionality

user_input: What is the purpose of load-balancing steering mode enhancements? [3GPP Release 17]

response: grnti
reference: the scrambling sequence generator is initialized with datascramblingidentitypdsch for a pdcch with the crc scrambled by grnti in a common search space

user_input: Which RRC state is the UE in when no RRC connection is established? [3GPP Release 17]
response: rrc idle
reference: when no rrc connection is established the ue is in rrcidle state

user_input: How are the antenna elements placed on each antenna panel? [3GPP Release 17]
response: antenna elements are placed in configurations optimized for coverage gain and radiation patterns often utilizing vertical and horizontal arrays sectorization and beamforming techniques

response: user location information user identity information emergency context information

user_input: What is the purpose of cross-network slice coordination? [3GPP Release 17]
response: the purpose of crossnetwork slice coordination is to ensure seamless collaboration and resource optimization between different network slices across multiple operators or domains enhancing service quality and enabling advanced use cases
